title.narrative: Training in cooperation with the UNDP on Insider Mediation

description.narrative: 1) Enhance the quality and competences of insider mediators that are actively taking part in peace negotiation processes 2) Contribute to conflict-resolution capacity building, locally, regionally, and internationally 3) Support UNDP's peace initiatives for insider mediators.
16 Insider Mediators, selected by UNDP, from 13 different countries that are affected by war and/or conflict.

Training of two weeks on Clingendael for Insider Mediators in the skills of negotiation and mediation. The training was part of the UNDP Insider Mediation project, launched in 2015. The UNDP aims to support and institutionalize networks of insider mediators with the aim of having a new instrument for preventing conflict escalation and implementing peace agreements. Our training in The Hague was part of this framework.

title.narrative: Output 2: Relevant participation in trainings has increased
1. At least 30% of participants is female 2. At least 70% of female participants feels more confident in their ability to participate in in a negotiation/mediation process

comment.narrative: Indicator 1: will be established over 2017 Indicator 2: will be established over 2017
Indicator 1: 56% of the participants was female. Indicator 2: no data on this

title.narrative: Outcome 3: Sustainable cooperation with partner organisations has been established or intensified

1. Established cooperation with new partner organizations 2. Partner organizations send requests for follow up training activities 3. Increased interest of external organizations and stakeholders to collaborate with Clingendael (descriptive indicator), for example through training modules and training design

comment.narrative: This was a training in cooperation with UNDP, which was also responsible for participant selection. Thus it can be said that cooperation with partner organisations is already established here.
This was a training in cooperation with UNDP, which was also responsible for participant selection. Thus it can be said that cooperation with partner organisations is already established here.

title.narrative: Output 1: Trainings are provided to relevant persons

1. At least 80% of participants is already active in negotiations and/or mediation, or wants to become more active in this field; 2. At least 75% of participants rated the training received as useful in their current or anticipated work; 3. At least 75% of participants rated the training received with at least a 4 on a scale of 1 to 5. 4. At least 60% feels very confident in their ability to participate in a negotiation/mediation process or to support others during negotiation/mediation; 5. At least 75% of participants expects to implement gained knowledge and skills in their work.

comment.narrative: We do not have a baseline for these indicator yet, this will be established based on the participation and feedback over 2017.

Trainer assessment: Indicator 1: Participants were selected by UNDP and ranged from various countries and experience levels. Some had many years of experience as a mediator while others only recently started their work in mediation and had no (academic) background in conflict resolution. For other trainings it is recommend that clearer selection criteria and a more effective process in selecting participants is needed.
